fields.subject: Thank you for participating in our Rising Team pre-launch test!
fields.preheader: Here’s all the info you need to get started.
fields.content:
Thank you for trying out a very early version of Rising Team! We’re inviting a small group of people to help us test some of the exercises that we plan to use in the product. Your feedback is valuable and will directly impact what we build. Here’s some quick context about what to expect:

  • About Rising Team: Our premise is simple: great managers are like great coaches. We’ve developed exercises—backed by research and road-tested with decades of management experience—that help managers learn how to lead like a coach. To learn more, visit https://risingteam.com.
  • About this test: We are in development and looking for early feedback. Many parts of Rising Team are still under construction, so some of these pages have placeholder designs and may not behave like you expect. The primary goal of this test is to ask you to try the three exercises we’ve included and, afterwards, we’ll send you a survey asking for feedback. You don’t need to be a people manager to participate.

To get started, click here to create an account. Then, proceed to take the three exercises you’ll see listed. After you complete the exercises, please also click on the “Coach” tab to see what this will look like from a manager’s perspective. Note: the product is not yet mobile-optimized, so we recommend using a laptop or desktop computer.

As you take the exercises, pay attention to the process: it’s valuable for us to know any place you feel stuck or confused. In particular, we are interested in whether the results of the exercises feel true to who you are and whether the results are useful. If you do plan to use the Rising Team beta, you will create a new account for that, so nothing from this test will be stored.

From all of us at Rising Team, thank you. We are grateful for your help and we are excited to have you with us for this first phase of the journey. Feel free to reach out to me anytime for help or with feedback at jen@risingteam.com.

fields.subject: ✏️ Take the Appreciations exercise on Rising Team
fields.preheader: Public recognition, shared experiences, cold hard cash… What makes you feel appreciated?
fields.content: Your manager, {{manager.first_name}}, has kicked off the Appreciations exercise for you to take on Rising Team. Whether it’s recognition from leadership, shared experiences, or cold hard cash, we all have different ways we like to be appreciated. This exercise illuminates how you most like to be appreciated by others. It should take around 10 minutes to complete and will create a shared document for you and your manager to review together during your next 1:1. You can also choose to share it with the other people on your team.

fields.subject: Take the MOTIVATORS exercise on Rising Team
fields.preheader: Motivators are the things you care about to make you happy at work.
fields.content:
{{manager.first_name}} {{manager.last_name}} has kicked off the MOTIVATORS exercise for you to take on Rising Team. Your motivators are the things you care about to make you happy at work. This exercise will highlight the factors that matter most to you, so your manager knows. No wrong answers!


The exercise should take around 10 minutes to complete and will create a shared document for you and your manager to review together during your next 1:1.

fields.subject: ✏️ Take the User Manual exercise on Rising Team
fields.preheader: If you were an appliance, what should we know about how you operate?
fields.content: Your manager, {{manager.first_name}}, has kicked off the User Manual exercise for you to take on Rising Team. Your User Manual is a way to help your manager and colleagues learn how best to work with you. If you were an appliance, what should we know about how you operate? The exercise should take around 20 minutes to complete. Everyone on your team will see your User Manual and, after others complete it, you’ll see theirs too.

fields.subject: {{member.first_name}} {{member.last_name}} has completed the Talents exercise
fields.preheader: Review their results now.
fields.content: Hi from Rising Team! Just a quick note to let you know that {{member.first_name}} {{member.last_name}} has completed the Talents exercise. You’ll see this as part of your next 1:1 document, but if you’d like to review now, visit your Team tab on Rising Team where you’ll find individual profiles for everyone on your team.

fields.subject: {{member.first_name}} {{member.last_name}} has completed the Appreciations exercise
fields.preheader: Review their results now.
fields.content: Hi from Rising Team! Just a quick note to let you know that {{member.first_name}} {{member.last_name}} has completed the Appreciations exercise. You’ll see this as part of your next 1:1 document, but if you’d like to review now, visit your Team tab on Rising Team where you’ll find individual profiles for everyone on your team.

fields.subject: {{member.first_name}} {{member.last_name}} has completed the Motivators exercise
fields.preheader: Review their results now.
fields.content: Hi from Rising Team! Just a quick note to let you know that {{member.first_name}} {{member.last_name}} has completed the Motivators exercise. You’ll see this as part of your next 1:1 document, but if you’d like to review now, visit your Team tab on Rising Team where you’ll find individual profiles for everyone on your team.

fields.subject: {{member.first_name}} {{member.last_name}} has completed the User Manual exercise
fields.preheader: Review their results now.
fields.content: Hi from Rising Team! Just a quick note to let you know that {{member.first_name}} {{member.last_name}} has completed the User Manual exercise. You’ll see this as part of your next 1:1 document, but if you’d like to review now, visit your Team tab on Rising Team where you’ll find individual profiles for everyone on your team.

fields.subject: Welcome to Rising Team!
fields.preheader: Get started today.
fields.content:
Hi {{member.first_name}}, I’m Jen, the founder of Rising Team. I’m so happy you signed up for our beta! To get started, we recommend jumping into our Playbook: a set of bite-sized tutorials that make it easy for you to learn the Rising Team system and ignite the full potential of your team. The Playbook will help you integrate our tools into your day-to-day routine. Additionally, be sure to to join our private Slack community called The Huddle. It’s a safe space for ideas, advice, and support on your journey as a manager that we facilitate for you and other managers using Rising Team.


We’re still in beta and we appreciate any and all feedback; just reply here or email us at hello@risingteam.com anytime!

fields.subject: Welcome to Rising Team!
fields.preheader: Get started today.
fields.content:
Hi {{member.first_name}}, I’m Jen, the founder of Rising Team. Thanks for signing up!


Rising Team makes it easy for your manager, {{manager.first_name}}, to provide consistent support and coaching on your professional development. A small investment from you in using these tools will help make that happen.


What to expect:﻿


  • A series of short, reflective exercises about your work life that each take less than 10 minutes to do: These are designed to start a discussion with your manager about the things that matter most to your happiness at work. You’ll get an email when your manager is ready for you to take the first one!
  • An interactive template for your 1-on-1 meetings that both you and your manager fill out ahead of time: Make 1:1s better than just a basic routine check-in by taking 10 minutes beforehand to fill out our painless template with work, life, and career prompts. You’ll get an email with a link to your first 1:1 meeting template when your manager sets it up in our system.


Work is a team sport, and we designed the Rising Team system to help everyone to feel more engaged, more supported, and more connected to their team at work. To that end, a great first step is to take our anonymous survey to record how you feel today on your team and working with your manager—so you can see how it changes over time.


We’re still in beta and we appreciate any and all feedback; just reply here or email us at hello@risingteam.com anytime!

fields.subject: Reset your password
fields.preheader: Create a new password for your Rising Team account.
fields.content:
Hi from Rising Team!


Forgot your password? Use the button below to create a new one.


You can also reply to this email if you need further assistance.

fields.subject: Bring the team together to discuss your User Manuals
fields.preheader: Share, reflect, and build deeper relationships as a group.
fields.content:
Good news! Everyone on your team has submitted their User Manual exercise. As a next step, schedule a team meeting for everyone to share their own personal User Manuals to get to know each other better.


The best coaches turn their teams into a cohesive unit by building authentic relationships between team members. Hosting a meeting (even a virtual one) for your team to share their User Manuals is a great opportunity to build community within your team.


Here’s how:


  • Schedule a meeting with everyone on your team. While in-person is great when possible, virtual meetings work well too.

  • Make it a safe space by sharing a few ground rules around confidentiality, no tech distractions, and a time limit per person. Tip: Use a timer on your phone to stay on track.

  • Invite each person to share their User Manuals, primarily focused on the open-ended questions. Encourage people to be as open and vulnerable as possible. Make sure you, as the manager, go first to serve as a role model.

  • Leave time at the end for the team to reflect as a group on the exercise and anything new they learned about themselves or a teammate.


Good luck and have fun!


PS: Reply to this email to let us know what you think of the User Manual exercise after you’ve met!

fields.subject: You're invited to join the Rising Team beta
fields.preheader: Work is a team sport.
fields.content:
Welcome to the Rising Team private beta! We’ve had a lot of interest and are pleased to confirm early access for you and your team. 


The Rising Team platform and tools are designed to help you excel as a manager and ignite the full potential of your team. Our beta includes fun exercises and a 1-on-1 meeting template that make it easy to better understand and support the people you manage. To get started, click here to create an account.


We’re glad to have you on this journey with us!

fields.subject: Invite to join Rising Team from {{manager.first_name}} {{manager.last_name}}
fields.preheader: Sign up for a free account.
fields.content:
{{manager.first_name}} {{manager.last_name}} has signed up for early access to the Rising Team beta and invited you to join. Click here to get started and create your profile.


Rising Team is a new platform designed to help your manager better support you and your career. It takes just a small time commitment from you each week—10 to 15 minutes—to have a big impact.


We’re glad to have you on this journey with us!

fields.subject: Say hello to your new 1-on-1 template
fields.preheader: It's easy to use and makes 1:1s a snap.
fields.content:
Transform your 1:1s with the Rising Team template. It offers a system to keep you consistent in the support you provide to the individuals on your team. Using our template will help you have authentic coaching conversations and cover all the areas that research shows are important to great management.


To get started, visit your Rising Team homepage to see a dashboard of your team. From there, set the dates for your next 1:1 with each person to sync them in our system.


Prep before your meeting

We send you an email the day before your 1:1 to fill out the meeting template. This takes less than 10 minutes of your time to do.


Look for the yellow boxes

You and your team member share access to the meeting template and have your own sections to fill out ahead of time. Yours are marked in yellow and will have an icon with your first initial.


Use it as your meeting agenda

Open the 1:1 template during your meeting to read what your team member wrote, and treat it as your agenda. You can review all the sections in order in each meeting, or just focus on certain ones.


PS: To learn how to use our 1:1 tool with your team, visit Unit 3 of the Rising Team Playbook.

fields.subject: Better teamwork awaits you
fields.preheader: Complete your profile to get started.
fields.content:
Thanks for creating your account on Rising Team! Complete your profile and get started with our playbook.


Your feedback at this early stage is invaluable to us so, if there’s a reason why you dropped off, could you please reply to this email to let me know?

fields.subject: Your team is using Rising Team
fields.preheader: Complete your profile to get started.
fields.content:
Thanks for creating your account on Rising Team! Help your manager better support you by logging in to complete your profile.


You can also reply to this email with any technical issues or questions.

fields.subject: 🧡 Monthly manager health survey
fields.preheader: How are things going?
fields.content:
Hi {{manager.first_name}},


It’s been a month since we last asked about how things are feeling for you as a manager. We send you this survey monthly so you can track how your answers change over time on your Rising Team profile—and so you can see whether Rising Team is making a positive impact.

It’s just two minutes, 12 questions long. Your team members also take a monthly survey as part of Rising Team. For teams with at least three people, those average results will be viewable in the team overview section of your Team tab under Team Health.

fields.subject: ⏰ Reminder: New exercise on Rising Team
fields.preheader: Visit Rising Team to complete the new exercise.
fields.content: Your manager, {{manager.first_name}}, kicked off a new exercise for you and your teammates to complete on Rising Team. Complete the exercise, which should only take around 10 minutes to do, and then plan to discuss it with your manager in your next 1:1.

fields.subject: It’s been a while since your last team exercise
fields.preheader: See what’s next on Rising Team and learn to manage like a coach!
fields.content:
It’s been a while since your last team exercise. Visit Rising Team to find out what exercises come next for you and your team.


Each exercise gives you a new opportunity to understand more about your team members and manage like a coach.


I’m eager to learn about your experience using Rising Team so far. If you have a minute to spare, please hit reply on this email to share your thoughts!

fields.subject: ➡️ Important! Invite your team to take exercise
fields.preheader: Their results are automatically shared with you.
fields.content:
You recently completed an exercise on Rising Team. Next, invite everyone on your team to take it too.


As your team members complete the exercise, their results are automatically shared with you. Plus, you’ll get a composite view of the exercise results across your team so you can identify areas of overlap in how people respond to the questions.


Not sure how to use this exercise with your team? Visit the Rising Team Playbook to:

  • Learn how to interpret exercise results—both per person and for your team overall

  • Get tips for how to talk about results with individual team members

fields.subject: Say hello to your new 1-on-1 template
fields.preheader: It’s easy to use and makes your 1:1s a snap.
fields.content:
A 1:1 is the primary time you have to get support from your manager, so make the most of it the Rising Team 1:1 template. All it takes is a few minutes of prep time from you, and our template structure makes it easy to consistently get the support you need from your manager.


Your manager, {{manager.first_name}}, scheduled an upcoming 1:1 in our system on {{due_date|date:"l, F j"}}.


Prep before your meeting

We send you an email the day before your 1:1 to fill out the meeting template. This takes less than 10 minutes of your time to do.


Look for the yellow boxes

You and your manager share access to the meeting template and have your own sections to fill out ahead of time. Yours are marked in yellow and will have an icon with your first initial.


Use it as your meeting agenda

Open the 1:1 template during your meeting to read what your manager wrote, and treat it as your agenda. You can review all the sections in order in each meeting, or just focus on certain ones.


For a full walkthrough, visit our step-by-step guide.

fields.subject: Prep for your 1:1 with {{manager.first_name}} {{manager.last_name}}
fields.preheader: Capture your thoughts ahead of time in our pre-meeting questionnaire.
fields.content:
Your 1:1 with {{manager.first_name}} {{manager.last_name}} is scheduled for {{due_date|date:"l, F j"}}.


Fill out your portions of our questionnaire (look for the yellow boxes!) before the meeting to make the most of your 1:1 time:

  • Progress on your goals or action items since you last met

  • Anything happening at work or outside of work that’s on your mind

  • Examples of how your manager is supporting you or could do better in providing support

fields.subject: Prep for your 1:1 with {{member.first_name}} {{member.last_name}}
fields.preheader: Capture your thoughts ahead of time in our pre-meeting questionnaire.
fields.content:
Your 1:1 with {{member.name}} is scheduled for {{due_date|date:"l, F j"}}.


Fill out your portions of our questionnaire (look for the yellow boxes!) before the meeting to make things easy:

  • Any real-time guidance since your last 1:1 that you want to recognize or coach

  • Key topics outside of the regular 1:1 template

  • Information sharing you want to cascade through your team

  • Any progress on your action items

fields.subject: When is your next 1-on-1 with {{member.first_name}} {{member.last_name}}?
fields.preheader: Add it on Rising Team so we can help you prepare.
fields.content: Looks like we’re missing the date of your next 1:1 with {{member.first_name}} {{member.last_name}}. Enter it now on Rising Team so we can send a reminder to you and {{member.first_name}} ahead of time with our meeting template.

fields.subject: Saying 👋🏼  and bumping your Rising Team invite
fields.preheader: Sign up today.
fields.content:
Hi there!

We sent you an invite to join the Rising Team private beta but you haven’t signed up yet. If you’re having any questions or technical issues, just hit reply on this email and we’ll help get it sorted.


Thank you for being part of the Rising Team beta.

fields.subject: 🧡 Monthly team health survey
fields.preheader: How are things going?
fields.content: Hi {{member.first_name}}, It’s been a month since we last asked about how things are feeling on your team and working with your manager, {{manager.first_name}}. We send you this survey monthly so you can track how your answers change over time on your Rising Team profile—and so your manager can get feedback on how they are doing as a coach for you. It’s just two minutes, 12 questions long.

fields.subject: 🧡 Monthly team health survey
fields.preheader: How are things going?
fields.content: Hi {{member.first_name}}, Please take our quick survey about how you feel today on your team and working with your manager, {{manager.first_name}}. We send you this team health survey monthly so you can track how your answers change over time on your Rising Team profile—and so your manager can get feedback on how they are doing as a coach for you. You might be wondering who can see what you say here. For teams with at least three people, your manager will see an average of the team’s responses to protect anonymity. For teams with fewer than three people, results will not be shared with your manager.

fields.subject: ⏰ Reminder! Manager health survey
fields.preheader: How are things going?
fields.content:
Hi {{member.first_name}},


Please take our quick manager health survey! We send you this survey monthly so you can track how your answers change through time—and so you can see whether Rising Team is making a positive impact. Your team members also take a monthly team health survey as part of Rising Team. For teams with at least three people, those average results will be viewable in the team overview section of your Team tab under Team Health.

fields.subject: ✔️ Reminder: You have an action item due tomorrow
fields.preheader: Mark as complete or update it today.
fields.content:
You have at least one action item due tomorrow that was assigned to you for follow-up during a recent 1:1 meeting:

    {% for task in tasks %}
  • {{task.primary}}
    • {% endfor %}

Visit Rising Team to mark it complete or update it with the latest information.

fields.subject: ✍️ {{person.first_name}} {{person.last_name}} has shared the {{exercise_name}} exercise on Rising Team with you
fields.preheader: Connect with your team in new ways.
fields.content:
Part of Rising Team is getting to know your team members in new ways and on a deeper level. That’s why we give everyone the option to share Rising Team exercise results with their full team.


{{person.name}} has shared results to the {{exercise_name}} exercise. Visit Rising Team today to check it out and connect with {{person.first_name}} about it afterwards.

fields.subject: ✏️ Take The Talents exercise on Rising Team
fields.preheader: It’s our version of a team drill!
fields.content: Your manager, {{manager.first_name}}, has kicked off the Talents exercise for your team to take on Rising Team. It’s designed to identify the things that come naturally to you and that you enjoy doing most at work, so your manager can help you get to do more of the work you enjoy. This exercise should take around 15 minutes to complete and will create a shared document for you and your manager to review together during your 1:1. You can also choose to share it with the other people on your team.

fields.subject: 🏆 Keep going with the playbook!
fields.preheader: You got this!
fields.content: Hi {{manager.first_name}}, We noticed you haven’t visited the Rising Team Playbook in a while. Each unit is designed to make it easy for you to learn the Rising Team system and integrate our tools into your day-to-day routine. Take the next step today and let the Playbook guide your way to ignite the full potential of your team! Your feedback at this early stage is invaluable to us so, if there’s a reason why you dropped off, could you please reply to this email to let me know?

fields.subject: 🎯 It’s time to retake your {{X}} exercise
fields.preheader: Have your answers changed?
fields.content: Hi there! A while back you took the {{X}} exercise on Rising Team and set a reminder to re-take it on {{date}}. It’s good to check in periodically on how things might have changed for both you and your team members since you last took it. Find a few minutes to retake the exercise yourself. Your team will be automatically notified on {{date}} to retake it, as well. Then, plan to discuss what’s changed since last time in your 1-on-1s. PS: If you need a refresher on how to discuss these results with your team, visit the Rising Team Playbook to get advice.

fields.subject: 🎯 It’s time to retake your {{X}} exercise
fields.preheader: Have your answers changed?
fields.content: Your manager, {{manager.first_name}}, has invited you and your teammates to retake the {{X}} exercise on Rising Team. You completed this exercise previously, but it’s good to check in periodically on how things might have changed since then. Think your answers have changed? Find out by retaking the exercise! Then, plan to discuss it in your next 1-on-1 with {{manager.first_name}}.

fields.subject: 👋 Still interested in Rising Team? See our all-new site!
fields.preheader: Get started today.
fields.content:
Hi,


With people working remotely and navigating new business challenges, it’s now more important than ever to connect with your team on a deeper level.


Today we are excited to announce a new and improved product—inspired by feedback from our early users. With this all-new version, now is a great time to try Rising Team by joining our free, private beta.


What’s new on Rising Team


  • Introducing the Playbook: Follow a series of bite-sized tutorials to help you learn the tools and how to use them to ignite your team’s full potential.

  • A streamlined homepage with team dashboard: See a birds-eye view of your team’s activity on Rising Team with our re-designed homepage.

  • New activity in The Huddle, our private Slack community: Get to know other managers who are using Rising Team with a system of fun daily prompts that we call “Magic Hat”! You’re eligible to join The Huddle after you sign up. (Soon we’ll be giving managers the ability to use Magic Hat with your own teams.)


We envision a world where everyone in the workforce is deeply understood, supported, and empowered to reach their goals. We’re proud to see managers using Rising Team to do just that.


My team and I—entirely remote since the very beginning!—are so excited to release this new version. Here we are in a recent team meeting with our Friday dress-up hat theme. We’re here to help, so simply reply to this email to get in touch.
